page.title: 01Staindrop.
page.content: Staindrop is situated in south west Durham, six miles from Barnard Castle and seven miles from Bishop Auckland. It is in the lush green valley of the Tees and the rolling hills of the Pennines can be seen in the distance. The site of Staindrop is flat, with the small tributatory of the Tees, Langley Beck flowing to the north of the village and Sudburn Beck flowing to the south. The name Staindrop is of old English origin, 'Staener'means stony and 'hop' a valley. This, together with late 8th century parts in the parish church indicates that Staindrop has a history going back beyond the Norman conquest. Included in the survey area is Raby Castle and park and over the centuries the castle and village have been closely associated, with the Raby Estate providing employment and
